root.name: listAttributes()

example.code: # The following short XML file called "mammals.xml" is parsed # in the code below. It must be in the project's "data" folder. # # &lt?xml version=&quot1.0&quot?&gt # &ltmammals&gt # &ltanimal id=&quot0&quotspecies=&quotCapra hircus&quot&gtGoat&lt/animal&gt # &ltanimal id=&quot1&quotspecies=&quotPanthera pardus&quot&gtLeopard&lt/animal&gt # &ltanimal id=&quot2&quotspecies=&quotEquus zebra&quot&gtZebra&lt/animal&gt # &lt/mammals&gt def setup(): xml = loadXML("mammals.xml") firstChild = xml.getChild("animal") println('\n'.join(firstChild.listAttributes())) # Print line-separated list items # Sketch prints: # [0] "id" # [1] "species"

root.description: Gets all of the specified element's attributes, and returns them as a list of Strings.
